intro: Gomphrena sericea, commonly known as the silky plume or velvet flower, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is a member of the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its showy, plume-like inflorescences that range in color from pink to red. The plant typically grows as an annual or biennial herb, reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered with fine hairs, giving them a silky texture. Gomphrena sericea is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
